Ice::

She was roared again in the chamber just as the seditive was taking 
effect. She fell into a deep sleep. 

Her mind stilll focused on the cage. She had always been free. Free 
to move where the wind took her. Now with her new body, she could 
have been free to roam the iced lands and wander where the land took 
her. But instead, this virus trapped her. She was a threat to herself 
and all those around her. She could see the cage of metal bars 
surounding her and keeping her shut in.  She was no longer free, but 
a prisoner. And one the might have to be destroyed. She roared out in 
her sleep as the thought of them having to kill her ran through her 
thoughts. Despite the seditive, she was in a fitful sleep. 


--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, "CYBERWOLF4" <cyberwolf4@p...> wrote:
> OOPS, tried to reply yesterday, guess it didn't go through.
> 
> Lunarpine sensed fear from Ice, she was becomeing more terrified at 
every
> moment. He set her inside the transport pod and set the coordinates 
for
> Veratis' base. The pod quickly sped back to the base in time to 
save Ice.
> Lunarpine tried to make sense of her thoughts, they seemed mixxed 
up beyond
> comprehension. She wasn't afraid of the virus, she was more afraid 
of
> something else. he tried to focus, the visions made little sense to 
him. Why
> would she be thinking about a cage at a time like this. Her roar 
echoed
> deafeningly in his head. "Calm down." He shouted to her hopeing she 
had at
> least a little comprehension. The cleaning drones helped the 
struggling bot
> carry Ice back inside and into the lab. He forced himself to resist 
the urge
> to scream as he placed her into her CR chamber. He hoped that this 
would
> settle her. Almost immediately a sedative flooded the tank intended 
to calm
> her.
> 
> Veratis raced into the lab and activated the DNA sequencers. He 
hoped that
> the intervention of her origional DNA would counteract the virus. 
He held
> his head as if it would explode if he let go. "What happened out 
there?" the
> old science bot asked when the sedative took effect on Ice.
> 
> "She paniced I think." Lunarpine answered looking on at her new 
form inside
> the chamber.
> 
> "Now it's your turn." Veratis stated in an almost demanding manner 
as he
> pointed Lunarpine into the other chamber. "We can't take the chance 
that the
> virus may have mutated." Veratis watched the scanners as Lunarpine 
stepped
> inside.
> 
> Foxfingers locked himself in his room while he waited for the viral
> emergency to calm down. He suddenly came to a paniced realization. 
His
> samples were in the lab with the infected bots. If they were 
contaminated
> thered be hell to pay.
> 
>
